text: Cristian Mark Junior Nascimento Oliveira Baroni ( Belo Horizonte, June 25, 1983 ) is a former Brazilian footballer who played as a defensive midfielder. It is player in Brazilian footballer which is formerly, it is was formerly a Brazilian footballer. == Career == === Paulista === At the beginning of his career, Cristian was a standout in the youth ranks of Paulista de Jundiaí and was champion of the 2005 Copa do Brasil . === Atlético Paranaense === After winning the 2005 Copa do Brasil, the midfielder was signed by Atlético Paranaense on August 22, 2005. === Flamengo === In July 2007, he went to Flamengo and played a key role in the team's rise in the Brazilian Championship that year, leaving the relegation zone and qualifying for the Copa Libertadores da América . In 2008, despite remaining in the Flamengo squad, Cristian was on the bench for many matches. === Corinthians === Signed by Corinthians in September 2008, he played in some matches in Série B and was part of the group that gained access to Série A of the Brazilian Championship. The following year, in the 2009 Campeonato Paulista, Cristian scored the winning goal for Corinthians in the first game of the semi-final against rivals São Paulo, with 23 seconds left in the match at Pacaembu. The midfielder scored again in a comeback victory, again against São Paulo, where he made obscene gestures to the opposing fans during the celebration. In the following match, at Morumbi, striker Ronaldo scored a goal and repeated Cristian's gesture. A few months later, the midfielder was crowned champion of the Copa do Brasil. Cristian scored a single goal in the competition, on 29 April, in a 3–2 defeat to Atlético Paranaense in the first leg of the round of 16. Despite the negative result in the first match, Corinthians won 2-0 in the return game and qualified for the quarterfinals. === Fenerbahce === On July 20, 2009, Fenerbahçe announced the signing of the player for 7 million dollars. Corinthians ran a marketing campaign targeting Cristian's return in early 2012, but the plan did not come to fruition and the Brazilian midfielder remained in Turkey. == References == == Other websites == * Category:Footballers from Minas Gerais Category:1983 births Category:Living people
